entry.title: Coyote en Ayuno (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the first ray of sunlight on 23 April passes through the eye of the Coyote en Ayuno (pictured), which was built to commemorate the founding of Nezahualcóyotl, Mexico?

entry.title: José Ramón Balaguer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that José Ramón Balaguer fought as a soldier-medic for Fidel Castro's rebel army before becoming Cuba's minister of public health?

entry.title: 6th Louisiana Infantry Regiment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 6th Louisiana Infantry Regiment began with 916 men and ended with 52?

entry.title: Shanti Devi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shanti Devi was awarded the Padma Shri Award for her social work, including eradicating the yaws disease in a village in Odisha?

entry.title: Kommt her, ihr Kreaturen all (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Kommt her, ihr Kreaturen all", a Catholic hymn first published in 1687, is still commonly used for Corpus Christi processions?

entry.title: Hani al-Rahib (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Syrian novelist Hani al-Rahib had a deaf-mute father and an illiterate mother?

entry.title: Lake Brunner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 100-year-old logs, perfectly preserved and good enough to mill, have been retrieved from the bottom of Lake Brunner?

entry.title: Sir Thomas Peel Dunhill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sir Thomas Peel Dunhill used to milk the goats at St Vincent's Hospital?
